summary: SEAT RECLINER ADJUSTER HANDLES ATTACH TO A FERRELLED PIECE OF POT METAL THAT IS DRILLED AND SLOTTED TO ACCEPT A SCREW THAT HOLDS THE HANDLE.  THIS PIECE OF WEAK METAL BREAKS EASILY AND THE HANDLE FALLS OFF RENDERING THE BACK OF THE SEAT NON ADJUSTABLE.  SEVERAL DEALERS TELL ME THEY HAVE REPLACED HUNDREDS OF THESE AT A TOTAL COST OF $125 (LABOR AND PARTS).  GM TELLS CUSTOMERS THIS IS NORMAL WEAR AND CAN BE EXPECTED.  *NLM
